newsitem.title: USA: Apple executive Roizen to resign.
newsitem.headline: Apple executive Roizen to resign.

text.p: Apple Computer Inc on Monday said Heidi Roizen, vice president of developer relations, plans to step down on February 19 after a year at the troubled computer maker.
In a statement, Apple said Roizen, 38, "successfully designed and implemented key programs that have strengthened Apple's position with software developers."
The company did not say why she was leaving but people familar with her plans said she wanted to spend more time with her faimly.

"While we will miss Heidi, the lessons she has taught the organization will not be lost as Apple embarks on creating the Rhapsody platform, which should lead to many new opportunities for the developer community," said Guerrino de Luca, executive vice president Apple Marketing.
"Apple's management is taking dramatic positive action that I believe will lead the company to a turnaround," Roizen said in a statement.
Roizen's departure comes less than a week after Apple announced its second restructuring in a year as it tries to return to profitability.
